name: Structural Family Therapy (SFT)
summary: Structural Family Therapy is a therapeutic approach developed by Salvador Minuchin that focuses on restructuring family organization and boundaries to improve family functioning and resolve individual and relational problems.
description: Structural Family Therapy (SFT) was developed in the 1960s by psychiatrist Salvador Minuchin. It emphasizes the structure of the family system — its hierarchy, boundaries, and subsystems — as a central factor influencing individual and relational health. The therapist works actively with families to identify dysfunctional patterns, realign roles, and strengthen boundaries. Through direct engagement, role-playing, and restructuring interventions, SFT seeks to create healthier family dynamics and improve functioning across the family unit. It is widely used in the treatment of child and adolescent behavioral problems, family conflict, and psychosomatic disorders.

contraindications: Families with active domestic violence where conjoint sessions may be unsafe
clinical_metadata.safety_profile: Generally safe; potential for emotional discomfort when addressing conflict.
clinical_metadata.research_support: Supported by controlled trials showing effectiveness in reducing child behavior problems and improving family functioning.

sections.text: SFT works by restructuring the family’s organizational patterns. The therapist identifies dysfunctional hierarchies, diffuse or rigid boundaries, and maladaptive subsystems. By intervening directly in family interactions, the therapist helps realign roles, strengthen parental authority, and establish clearer boundaries. These structural changes foster healthier interactions and improved functioning across the family system.

sections.preparation: Family assessment to map hierarchy, boundaries, and subsystems.
procedure: Therapist highlights and challenges dysfunctional patterns.
Techniques include enactments, boundary making, and realignment of roles.
Therapist helps strengthen parental subsystem and adjust family structure.

sections.post_session: Reflection and integration of new interactional patterns.
